com.conceptwave.scripting
Class Finder

com.conceptwave.scripting.Object
  com.conceptwave.scripting.CWScriptable
      com.conceptwave.scripting.CwObject
          com.conceptwave.scripting.Finder

public class Finder
extends CwObject

A finder is an object that allows to perform search for data in different data sources (data bases, external system interfaces, etc.), as well as perform get delete and update operation. The result of the finder search operation is a data object list object.

Field Summary
 Controller controllerOwner
          READWRITE: Returns the user interface of this finder.
 com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer doubleClickCol
          READONLY: Returns column number that was double clicked in the finder.
 com.conceptwave.scripting.Boolean editable
          READONLY: If anything but a document or SQL finder, return true.
 Controller getRootFinderParent
          READONLY: If this finder is being shown as a result of a reference element icon click under an editable table, this method will return the finder in which the reference elemnt belongs.
 com.conceptwave.scripting.Boolean hideViewMenu
          READONLY: Returns true if this finder is set to hide the views list from the user.
 com.conceptwave.scripting.Boolean isRefEditable
          READONLY: If this finder is displayed as a reference finder, this flag determines whether the field is editable based on editable permission on the field itself, on the variable, or on the document it is being displayed in.
 com.conceptwave.scripting.Boolean isViewEditable
          READONLY: Finds the current view for this finder and evaluates the editable permission on the table element.
 Array items
          Deprecated. As of 4.1. Use 'list' method to get the finder result set. The method will be removed in version 6.0
 DataObjectList list
          READONLY: The last search result set as data object list.
 String parentLeafName
          READWRITE: The name of the leaf node for the reference finder or null if the finder is not reference finder.
 CwObject refFinderDocument
          READONLY: The parent object of the reference finder (the data object that contains the reference field) or null if the finder is not reference finder Parent types that support references: documents, data structures and controllers
 CwObject searchDocument
          READONLY: The finder search document or null if the finder does not have search document
 CwObject[] selected
          READWRITE: The array of selected records from the finder result set or null if nothing is selected.
 String selectOutputDocumentMetadataName
          READONLY: Metadata name of the result document.

Field Detail

controllerOwner

public Controller controllerOwner
READWRITE: Returns the user interface of this finder. controllerOwner is set when the finder user interface is first created.

doubleClickCol

public com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer doubleClickCol
READONLY: Returns column number that was double clicked in the finder.

editable

public com.conceptwave.scripting.Boolean editable
READONLY: If anything but a document or SQL finder, return true.

getRootFinderParent

public Controller getRootFinderParent
READONLY: If this finder is being shown as a result of a reference element icon click under an editable table, this method will return the finder in which the reference elemnt belongs.

hideViewMenu

public com.conceptwave.scripting.Boolean hideViewMenu
READONLY: Returns true if this finder is set to hide the views list from the user. The flag can be set by calling setViewByName(viewName, hideView). Note that this function is for backward compatibility.

isRefEditable

public com.conceptwave.scripting.Boolean isRefEditable
READONLY: If this finder is displayed as a reference finder, this flag determines whether the field is editable based on editable permission on the field itself, on the variable, or on the document it is being displayed in.

isViewEditable

public com.conceptwave.scripting.Boolean isViewEditable
READONLY: Finds the current view for this finder and evaluates the editable permission on the table element.

items

public Array items
Deprecated. As of 4.1. Use 'list' method to get the finder result set. The method will be removed in version 6.0
READONLY: The finder result set as an array. This method is inefficient, consumes additional memory and should be avoided.

list

public DataObjectList list
READONLY: The last search result set as data object list. May be empty.

parentLeafName

public String parentLeafName
READWRITE: The name of the leaf node for the reference finder or null if the finder is not reference finder. Used for 4.2 backward compatibility ONLY - for buttons with finders

refFinderDocument

public CwObject refFinderDocument
READONLY: The parent object of the reference finder (the data object that contains the reference field) or null if the finder is not reference finder Parent types that support references: documents, data structures and controllers

searchDocument

public CwObject searchDocument
READONLY: The finder search document or null if the finder does not have search document

selectOutputDocumentMetadataName

public String selectOutputDocumentMetadataName
READONLY: Metadata name of the result document.

selected

public CwObject[] selected
READWRITE: The array of selected records from the finder result set or null if nothing is selected. The array of selected records from the finder result set or null if nothing is selected.

Constructor Detail

Finder

public Finder(String metadataName)
Creates new finder object of specified metadata type

Parameters:
metadataName - Fully qualified metadata finder name
Method Detail

clearFilter

public void clearFilter(com.conceptwave.scripting.Boolean clear)
Set if filter criteria on the table element is to be cleared. Initial value of this flag is set to true. Once the value is sent, it will be set to false. When the filter criteria is cleared, a fetch for the original data will occur.

extractAndProcess

public com.conceptwave.scripting.Boolean extractAndProcess(Document searchDoc,
                                                           String startScriptName,
                                                           String processScriptName,
                                                           String endScriptName,
                                                           com.conceptwave.scripting.Object[] parameters,
                                                           DatabaseConnection con)
Run query and performs script on each result document. The documents are not stored in the result set. They are discarded after being processed.

Parameters:
searchDoc - Query search criteria document
startScriptName - Fully qualified name of a global script that will be executed before the first document is processed. Can be null. The global script will receive the current document as first parameter and then the parameters specified in the "parameters" parameter.
processScriptName - Fully qualified name of a global script that will be run for each document fetched by the query. Can't be null. The global script will receive the current document as parameter and then the parameters specified in the "parameters" parameter.
endScriptName - Fully qualified name of a global script that will be executed after the last document is processed. Can be null. The global script will receive the parameters specified in the "parameters" parameter.
parameters - Can be a single object or array of objects that are passed as parameters to the global scripts or null.
con - database connection that will be used for finder search. Can be null. If null, finder will use connection from context.
Returns:
returns false if processing was stopped (by calling 'stopProcessing' function) before fully completed, otherwise returns true.

public com.conceptwave.scripting.Boolean getAutoSearch()
Retrieve the auto search flag set on the current view being used for this data object

Returns:
boolean Is the current view in auto search mode

hasSearched

public com.conceptwave.scripting.Boolean hasSearched()
Determines whether the search function has been called for this finder data object. It is possible for the finder controller to have been given an already defined data object with a list of results.

Returns:

isSingleClickDetail

public com.conceptwave.scripting.Boolean isSingleClickDetail()
No longer supported - single click detail can be achieved by setting "show detail column" property on the finder's table element

Returns:

performOperation

public com.conceptwave.scripting.Object performOperation(String operation,
                                                         CwObject doc)
Perform finder operation on the current finder

Parameters:
operation - The operation name. Can be one of 'add', 'delete', 'get', 'select', 'update'
doc - The search criteria document. if null the default search document will be used if needed
Returns:
DataObjectList if the operation is 'select' or Document or null for the other operations
Throws:
CwfException - if the operation name is invalid

putInCache

public void putInCache()
Stores the result set of the finder in the document cache. The copy of each document document is converted to immutable document, and stored in the cache. Any attempt to set a leaf value of the cached document will throw exception.

runFinder

public static com.conceptwave.scripting.Object runFinder(String finderName,
                                                         String operation,
                                                         CwObject sDoc)
Performs the specified finder operation. If the operation is 'select' and the search document parameter is null the current finder search document will be used. For 'select' operation the search initialization script is performed.

Parameters:
finderName - Fully qualified finder name
operation - The operation name. Can be one of 'add', 'delete', 'get', 'select', 'update'
sDoc - Parameter for the operation - a data document or null. For "select" operation sDoc represents the search document, for "get" operation - a result document with the document key fields/document id set, for "add" operation the new document to be added, for "delete" operation - the document to be deleted (only the document key fields/document id are needed) and for "update operation - the document to be updated.
Returns:
DataObjectList if the operation is 'select' or Document or null for the other operations
Throws:
CwfException - if the the finder name or operation name is invalid

runSearch

public static DataObjectList runSearch(String finderName,
                                       Document searchDoc,
                                       com.conceptwave.scripting.Object timeout)
Performs a search operation on the specified finder. If run in UI mode the corresponding timeout interval will apply for the operation.

Parameters:
finderName - Fully qualified metadata finder name
searchDoc - Optional search document. If not specified a default search document will be used.
timeout - Optional timeout. If not specified or negative the operation will timeout after the time interval specified in the metadata finder or if not specified after the timeout interval in the Configuration. If 0 the operation will never timeout. If positive the operation will timeout after the specified number of seconds
Returns:
Data object list containing the result of the search. May be empty.

search

public DataObjectList search(DataObjectList list,
                             CwObject searchDoc,
                             com.conceptwave.scripting.Object timeout,
                             com.conceptwave.scripting.Object maxRows)
Performs a search operation using the current search document of the finder. If run in UI mode the corresponding timeout interval will apply for the operation.

Parameters:
list - Optional data object list that will contain the result of the search
searchDoc - Optional search document. If not specified the current finder search document will be used.
timeout - Optional timeout. If not specified or negative the operation will timeout after the time interval specified in the metadata finder or if not specified after the timeout interval in the Configuration. If 0 the operation will never timeout. If positive the operation will timeout after the specified number of seconds
maxRows - Optional max rows parameter. If specified, overrides max rows defined in Finder metadata. Cannot be larger than max rows defined in Finder metadata.
Returns:
Data object list containing the result of the search. May be empty.

setCurrentViewIndex

public void setCurrentViewIndex(com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer viewIndex)
sets the view by the index of the view

Parameters:
viewIndex - the index of the view

setList

public void setList(DataObjectList dol)
Replaces the finder last search list.

Parameters:
dol - Data object list or null.

setRefEditable

public void setRefEditable(com.conceptwave.scripting.Boolean isRefEditable)
If this finder is displayed as a reference finder, this flag determines whether the field is editable based on editable permission on the field itself, on the variable, or on the document it is being displayed in.

Parameters:
isRefEditable -

setResultForm

public void setResultForm(String resultForm)
Sets the result form being used by the finder controller.. If a custom view is currently being used, it will be reset to the original state.

Parameters:
resultForm - result form to use for this finder

setSearchForm

public void setSearchForm(String searchFormName)
Sets the search form being used by the finder controller provided the search document contains a form with the same name.

Parameters:
searchFormName - search form to use for this finder

setSearchObject

public void setSearchObject(CwObject dobj)

setViewByName

public com.conceptwave.scripting.Boolean setViewByName(String viewName,
                                                       com.conceptwave.scripting.Boolean hide)
Set finder view.

Parameters:
viewName - The name of the desired view.
hide - Hide view menus.
Returns:
false

sort

public void sort(String sortString)
Sorts the current search result list using the specified metadata sort order.

Parameters:
sortString - Optional sort specification string. If not string the sorting specified in the metadata finder will be used The sort specification string has form "field,field,..." where field is the finder output document field name preceded by minus sign if descending sorting is needed.

stopProcessing

public void stopProcessing()
Stops "Extract and Process" operation that currently in progress. Should be used in data processing script to stop data extraction and processing

updateUI

public void updateUI()
Force UI to update.
